snippet: The attack followed a pattern that has come to be known as the double tap, where warplanes bomb an area, then bomb again, often after rescuers have arrived.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut.
byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Airstrikes carried out near rebel-held areas of Idlib Province, Syria, kill at least six civilians; it is not clear who carried out strikes, though both Russian and Syrian forces have been operating in area.

keywords.value: White Helmets (Syrian Civil Defense Volunteer Group)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The attack followed a pattern that has come to be known as the double tap, where warplanes bomb an area, then bomb again, often after rescuers have arrived.

headline.print_headline: Airstrikes Kill Rescue Worker and Family of 5 in Syria
headline.main: Airstrikes Kill Rescue Worker and Family of 5 in Syria
